title: CSSAnimatable

metadata.description: Learn about CSSAnimatable with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title: Details
content_sections.content:
Definition and Usage
Some CSS properties are
animatable
, meaning that they can be used in animations and transitions.
Animatable properties can change gradually from one value to another, like size, numbers, percentage and color.
Browser Support
The animation properties are supported in all modern browsers.
The numbers in the table specifies the first browser version that fully support CSS animations.
43
10
16
9
30
Example
Animate the background-color from red to blue:
@keyframes mymove
{
from {background-color: red;}
to {background-color: blue;}
}

Animatable Properties
These properties are
animatable
in CSS:
Property
aspect-ratio

summary: This tutorial covers CSSAnimatable concepts and techniques. You'll learn how to use CSSAnimatable effectively, including key principles, common patterns, and practical examples. By the end of this tutorial, you'll have a solid understanding of CSSAnimatable and how to apply it in your projects.
